article.title: problem solving
article.p:
problem solving
, Process involved in finding a solution to a problem. Many animals routinely solve problems of locomotion, food finding, and shelter through trial and error. Some higher animals, such as apes and cetaceans, have demonstrated more complex problem-solving abilities, including discrimination of abstract stimuli, rule learning, and application of language or languagelike operations. Humans use not only trial and error but also insight based on an understanding of principles, inductive and deductive reasoning (
see
deduction
;
induction
; and
logic
), and divergent or creative thinking (
see
creativity
). Problem-solving abilities and styles may vary considerably by individual.
